title: NANDIKAR
detailsOfAchievement: NANDIKAR A bunch of young persons, under the leadership of Ajitesh Bandyapadhyay, on June 29, 1960, founded Nandikar. ACTIVITIES: 1) Production and Performance of Plays: â€¢ During last 50 years, Nandikar mounted about 8o productions of plays from the West and our own, from the ancient to contemporary. These productions have been performed more than 7,500 times all over the country and abroad. â€¢ Nandikar also catalyzed about 36 Youth Theatre productions and also 100 Children Theatre Productions. 2) Nandikar has repeatedly performed in Bangladesh, Scotland, England, USA Canada, Sweden, Norway, Germany, Oman and China by presentation of plays, conducting Workshops and Dialogues. 3) National and International Theatre Festivals . â€¢ Nandikar organized 25 Theatre Festivals with National and Occasional participation. â€¢ Organized 2 National Womenâ€™s Theatre Festivals. â€¢ Also organized 26 Children Theatre Festivals 4) Theater - In - Education (TIE): Nandikar has been successfully engaged in Undertaking consistent programme on Theatre in Education among the students of schools, college, teachers and guardians for last 20 years, in 250 schools. 5) Theatre among variously challenged children and young persons. 6) SUPPORTED by Government Departments/National Organizations â€¢ It has worked with the Ministries of Culture; Youth Affairs and Sports; Women and Child welfare; and Human Resource Development (Department of Education); and â€¢ With the Sangeet Natak Akademi, Sahitya Akademi, National School of Drama, Indian Council for Cultural Relations and the Indian Council for Social Science Research, to name a few. 7) WORK WITH CHILDREN AND THE YOUNG â€¢ Nandikar, at the initiative of Department of Education HRD, began its â€œTheatre for the Motivation & Liberation of Student Community in Schoolsâ€ since 1989. While continuing this pioneering works, Nandikar began Childrenâ€™s Theatre on a larger and professional scale with support from Foreign Agencies: â€¢ Nandikar began its Project â€œIn Search of Childrenâ€™s Theatreâ€ in the early nineties with support from the Ford Foundation. This seven-year project involved work with Variously-Deprived Children (e.g. Slum/Pavement-Dwelling and the Visually Handicapped Children). â€¢ The work with Children resumed in 2004 when Sida/Swedish ITI (International Theatre Institute), impressed with the groupâ€™s continuing work for and by the Children, offered funds for a three-year project. 8) NANDIKAR the Collaborator: Nandikar believed in seeking to find and in giving to receive. Hence it variously collaborated with Deptt. of Culture, Deptt. of Education, Deptt. of Women and Child Development, Ministry of Youth Affairs and Sports, Sangeet Natak Akademi, National School of Drama, Zonal Cultural Centres etc. and Banga Sammelans in the USA, Tagoreans, Nehru Centre UK, Brecht Zentrum, The British Council, Harvard University, The Ford Foundation, Rupantar and Rakhal of Bangladesh and Swedish ITI,Teater Pero, Dock Teatern Tittut, Marten Hedmanâ€™s Teater, Backa Theatre, Theatre with the Deaf & Dumb from Silent Teater and Sida â€“ all from Sweden. 9) Theatre in promotion of National Integration among the youth: Nandikar organizes week-long National Integration Camp for about 150 youth from various states. 10) Theatre as Aid to the Professionals; Nandikar undertakes various programme and activities using Theatre as a tool for developing and enriching the art of communication among the Teachers of Schools/ Colleges/ University, Corporate Executives and also future Managers (with IIM, IIT, XLRI) ACHIEVEMENTS: ACCOLADES/AWARDS â€¢ Two of its directors â€“ the late Ajitesh Bandyopadhyay and Rudraprasad Sengupta â€“ are recipients of the National Award; â€¢ Swatilekha Sengupta was chosen by Satyajit Ray as the leading lady for his film â€˜Home and the Worldâ€™; â€¢ Sohini Sengupta won the Presidentâ€™s award as Best Actress in both Film and Stage; â€¢ Gautam Haldar won the AV Birla award for best Indian Young Theatre Person; â€¢ It has won numerous State Awards on various counts.

title: Nandimukh
detailsOfAchievement: Nandimukh is a theatre organization founded by late Ajitesh Bandopadhyay. He was not only an institution for Bengali theatre but also was considered a trend setter in natural theatre. Nandimukh started its journey on 9th Sept. 1977 and some milestones of theatre both in content and form have been established by late Ajitesh Bandopadhyay. A few such milestones are â€œSherafganâ€ from Italian playwright Leuigi Pirandello, â€œPaap-punyaâ€ from Russian Philosopher Tolstoy, â€œTetrish Tamo Janmodibasâ€ from English Nobel laureate playwright Harold Pinterâ€™s â€œThe Birthday Party, â€œNana Ranger Dinâ€ and â€œPrastabâ€ from Russian playwright Anton Chekov and Ajitsh bandopadhyayâ€™s original drama â€œSoudagarer Noukaâ€. In the year 1982 â€œTetrish Tamo Janmodibashâ€ honoured as a best directed play by Ajitesh bandopadhyay of that year by the Paschim Banga Natya Academy , Govt. of West Bengal. The other well known theatre organization of Bengal Nandikar founded in 1960 was also the brain child of late Ajitesh Bandopadhyay and in unavoidable circumstances he left Nandikar and Nandimukh steps into the theatre arena. Nandimukh cannot be considered as successor of Nandikar in view of the fact that both the organizations are engaged in performance simultaneously. It can not be denied that there was a vacuum after Ajitesh Bandopadhyay breathed his last in the year 1983. After overcoming the shock of departure the great Guru, Ashoke Chattopadhyay, his close disciple took the charge and continuing till date. The first production of Ashoke Chattopadhyay â€œThik To Thikâ€ an adaptation from Pirandelloâ€™s original â€œRight you are if you think soâ€ This production staged nearly fifty times in Calcutta and suburbs and later it had televised in Kolkata Doordarshan Kendra. Gradually Nandimukh performed â€œAbastha Jaruriâ€ from Mrozek, the Polish playwright, â€œShanuâ€ from J. Anouilh, â€œYadi Ekaâ€ from black platwright Leroi Jones, â€œDristi Simayâ€ from American Playwright Arther Miller, and â€œBhootâ€ from Sangeet Natak Academy winner playwright Sri Mohit Chattopadhyay who was also acclaimed the â€œBest Dramaâ€ award by Paschim Banga Natya Academy, Govt. of West Bengal for the drama â€œBhootâ€ Again Nandimukh staged â€œMr. Rightâ€ written by Mohit Chattopadhyay and music composed by the eminent composer Kalyan Sen Barat, â€œNathuramâ€ from Tirthankar Chanda, and â€œParthiboâ€ written by Ashok Chattopadhyay based on Anton Chekovâ€™s Short story â€œThe Betâ€. Nandimukh next performed â€œTetrish Tamo Janmodibasâ€ with a new explanation and dimension to project the present time. This production has performed before an audience of EZCC Saltlake auditorium after getting the invitation from EZCC Kolkata. At present â€œYadidangâ€ and â€œBini Paiser Makkelâ€ is staging by Nandimukh and preparing another new production â€œEkti Manush Chaiâ€ inspired from a folk tale of India. Apart from play producing the organization celebrated the completion of Thirty third years in Bengali theatre at Sisir Mancha on 9th September 2009, with the presence of Mohit Chattopadhyay and Dr. Ranjit Kr. Samadder Officer of special duty of EZCC, Kolkata and has published a magazine with valuable articles of eminent theatre mastero. Apart from that Nandimukh is arranging voice training workshops, recitation training with the whole timers and non-whole timers in regular course.

detailsOfAchievement: On the 18th September, 1979 â€” a bunch of youth, with a view to nourishing them aesthetically, seeing the life in a positive light, analyzing and evaluating the cause and effect of different social complexities â€” formed NANDIPAT at Belghoria, Kolkata and went on working and enriching the â€˜Art of theatreâ€™ to their best. Nandipat has enacted thirty five plays, one-act and full-fledged, in and outside the state; has participated in different prestigious theatre festivals in India and in Bangladesh. The troupe has also been crowned with awards and honors for producing outstanding theatre productions, which have also been appreciated, by the theatre-luminaries and theatre lovers of our country. The productions like â€˜Swet Santrasâ€™, â€˜Trinayanâ€™, â€˜Teerthajatraâ€™, â€˜Samadhanâ€™ â€˜Mrityu-Na-Hatyaâ€™ â€˜Ballavpurer Rupkathaâ€™, â€˜Einstein-O-Indubalaâ€™, â€˜Ramanimohanâ€™, â€˜Kahâ€™, â€˜Aapadâ€™ are not only noteworthy for their profound aesthetic quality but also it bear the testimony of social commitment of the troupe and its associates. It may not be too much to mention that â€˜Teerthajatraâ€™, bagged the â€˜Best Directorâ€™ award by the Paschim Banga Natya Academy, Government of West Bengal; our another production â€˜Mrityu-Na-Hatyaâ€™, has also earned the honor of â€˜Best Productionâ€™ and the central actor of the play, has been adjudged the â€˜Best Actorâ€™ by the Paschim Banga Natya Academy, Government of West Bengal. Another actress acquired the â€˜best actorâ€™ award for the production â€˜Ramnimohanâ€™ offered by Sayak. The troupe has also the distinction of earning â€˜Dishari Puraskarâ€™. Nandipat feels that an exchange of ideas in the field of Bengali Language, literature, film and painting is a must to make the cultivation meaningful. Padma-Ganga Utsav, massive in nature and vast in magnitude has been organized by Nandipat in order to exchange cultural feelings between West Bengal and Bangladesh. The famous cultural luminaries like Mrinal Sen, Shambhu Mitra, Pandit Ajoy Chakraborty, graced the festival with their active participation. The Silver Jubilee Yearâ€™s Celebration has been organized successfully. A twelve day Youth Theatre Festival has been organized at Rabindra Sadan and Sisir Mancha. Thirteen young directors were invited to present their brilliant theatre productions. The festival was further enriched with the seminars on various topics related to theatre Experts and eminent theatre personalities from various walks of life always share their knowledge, experience and opinions through seminars, symposiums, lecture sessions on various topics related to theatre vis-Ã -vis society. Running in-house orientation-cum-training program on Theatre Education is another regular activity component of the troupe. NANDIPAT participated in the Bharat Rangmhotsav twice with its popular productions and also entrusted by the National School of Drama to take part in the Purbottor Natya Samroh with its famous creation. The troupe has extensively toured the Eastern Zone of India including Assam and Tripura with its theatre productions. The troupe has also participated in the festival of Dhaka Theatre, Bangladesh. Nandipat, despite young in age, always believes in fraternity and is respectful for national and international tradition of art and culture. With success and failure in productions and activities outside its periphery, these young men have always remained alive and responsive to their social callings.

detailsOfAchievement: Natadha : Achievements & Major Activities (1974 â€“ 2009) Natadha, mainly concentrated on Regional Theatre Culture at Howrah District in West Bengal since its inception in 1974. Along with regular performances of plays from classics to modern dramas, Natadha, for generation of awareness and promotion of theatre, also conducts training, workshop, seminars, orientation camp, festival and weekly shows. Emphasising on Youth & Childrenâ€™s Theatre, Natadha has been continuing its Youth & Childrenâ€™s Theatre Wing successfully where a good number of youth and children are being trained-up on all-out theatrical activities along with regular performances. Major activities during 35 years of journey â€“ 1. Produced over 50 Classical & Modern plays such as : Raktakarabi, Julius Caesar, Raja Pentheus, Bali, Phool Phutuk, Nasto Keno, Mahabharata, Palashi, Shakuntala, Ebong Socrates, Lav-Kush, Karna Ekhon, Reality & others. 2 Running a youth-wing to aware and motivate the youths in theatrical activities. 3. Running a children-wing viz. Mukti-Nikai for regular training & performance by a good number of children (about 30). 4. Initiated a Childrenâ€™s Library. 5. Produced 4 Joint productions assembling the renowned Theatre-Directors of Bengal as well as the energetic actors of different groups of which â€˜Mahabharataâ€™ achieved â€˜Best Directorâ€™s Award in 2003. 6. Build up a regular theatre centre viz. Natyakendraâ€™ at Ramgopal Mancha, Howrah where Natadha & other groups perform weekly since 2006. 7. Conducts a 10-days popular theatre-fest Janapriya Nataker Mela each year since 1998 at Sarat Sadan, Howrah (a big auditorium of 1200 audiences) in the aid of poor-ailing theatre workers. Till 2009, more than Rs. 4.00 lacs could be contributed for the purpose. 8. Assisting in publication of the only Bengali Weekly Theatre journal Prati Brihaspati Natya Mukhopatra for the last 14 years. 9. Honours the Theatre Dignitaries as well as the Back-Stage Creators in a regular manner. 10.Also arranges programme and participates in many activities on social aspects, natural calamities etc.

detailsOfAchievement: Educational facilies for the special children: The organisation is succesfully running an educational unit named as "Uttaran" to serve the Hearing Impaired, Mentally Retarded and Cerebral Palsy, Multiple disabled since 1990. Free Pre-primary, Primary and Junior level education facilities are available along with Physiotherapy, Music Therapy for the special childrenof this region. Vocational Training for the special Children: The organsiation is running a vocatinal Training programme to rehabilitate differently abaled adult. Sports & Games for the differntly abaled: The Organisation had successfully organized State and National Sports Meet of Hearing Impaired during the year 1993, 1995, 1999 and 2005 at Siliguri. North Bengal Zonal Sports Meet of the Deaf, Mentally Retarded and Cerebral Palsy was successfully organized since last Ten years with a view to develop latent sports talent of the disabled residing in several districts of North Bengal. Student & sports members of this organization represented West Bengal State in several National Games of the Deaf since 1991. Sports talent of this organisation represented India in, Asian Games of the Deaf at Malaysia and Taiwan during the year of 1996 and 1999 and World Games of the Deaf at Rome and Australia during the year 2000 and 2005 and achieved several medals. Man power development programme : The organisation is a recognised Study Centre of IGNOU and Netaji Subhas Open University to run B.Ed in special education and Certificate course in special education in distance mode.
